QAs.question: What is the empirical formula of the compound studied in the neutron diffraction experiments at 175 K?
QAs.answer: C8H14Fe2NO12

QAs.question: What structural phase transition is observed in the compound [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n based on the neutron diffraction patterns collected at different temperatures?
QAs.answer: The structural phase transition observed is from space group P-31c to R-3c, which involves a tripling of the c-axis associated with the ordering of the dimethylammonium countercations.

QAs.question: True or False: The magnetic structure of [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n below 37 K is collinear.
QAs.answer: False

QAs.question: What is the role of hydrogen bonds in the order-disorder phase transition of the compound [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n?
QAs.answer: The hydrogen bonds involving dimethylammonium hydrogen atoms as donors and oxygen atoms from the carboxylate group as acceptors trigger the order-disorder phase transition.

QAs.question: What type of magnetic structure is refined for [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n below 37 K using neutron diffraction data?
QAs.answer: A weakly noncollinear ferrimagnetic structure is refined, where the FeII and FeIII sites are antiferromagnetically coupled.

QAs.question: True or False: The magnetic moments of the Fe(18e) position in [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n are ordered in the ab-plane and coupled antiferromagnetically along the c-axis with the Fe(6b) and Fe(12c) positions.
QAs.answer: True

QAs.question: What is the significance of the compensation temperature (Tcomp) observed in the magnetization study of [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n?
QAs.answer: The compensation temperature (Tcomp) signifies the temperature below which the magnetization value of the FeIII sublattice becomes larger than that of the FeII sublattice, indicating a NeÃÅel N-Type ferrimagnet behavior.

QAs.question: True or False: The dielectric properties of [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n do not change upon the onset of magnetic order.
QAs.answer: False

QAs.question: What causes the electric transition observed in the dielectric measurements of [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n?
QAs.answer: The electric transition from a paraelectric to an antiferroelectric phase is triggered by the order-disorder transition of the dimethylammonium counterions.

QAs.question: True or False: The magnetic moments of Fe(6b) and Fe(12c) atoms in [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n are oriented strictly along the c-axis.
QAs.answer: True

QAs.question: What is the role of the extensive network of hydrogen bonds in the structural phase transition of [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n?
QAs.answer: The extensive network of hydrogen bonds plays a crucial role in anchoring the dimethylammonium cations during the order-disorder phase transition.

QAs.question: How does the magnetic structure of [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n contribute to its ferrimagnetic behavior?
QAs.answer: The ferrimagnetic behavior arises from the noncompensation of the FeII and FeIII magnetic moments, which are antiferromagnetically coupled, leading to a weakly noncollinear ferrimagnetic structure.

QAs.question: True or False: The magnetic moments of Fe(18e) atoms in [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n have no component in the ab-plane.
QAs.answer: False

QAs.question: What is the effect of temperature on the magnetic moments of Fe(18e) atoms in [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n?
QAs.answer: The magnetic contribution in the ab-plane of Fe(18e) atoms increases as the temperature increases, suggesting that the magnetic moment of FeII ions induces a more efficient antiferromagnetic coupling in the network of FeIII when the temperature decreases.

QAs.question: True or False: The structural phase transition from P-31c to R-3c in [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n does not involve a change in the ordering of the dimethylammonium countercations.
QAs.answer: False

QAs.question: What is the significance of the dielectric anomaly observed at ca. 155 K in [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n?
QAs.answer: The dielectric anomaly at ca. 155 K corresponds to the order-disorder phase transition involving the ordering of the dimethylammonium countercations, leading to a paraelectric to antiferroelectric phase transition.

QAs.question: True or False: The magnetic structure of [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n below 37 K is purely antiferromagnetic.
QAs.answer: False

QAs.question: How does the structural phase transition affect the electric properties of [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n?
QAs.answer: The structural phase transition affects the electric properties by triggering a transition from a paraelectric to an antiferroelectric phase, as evidenced by the anomaly observed in the dielectric measurements.

QAs.question: True or False: The magnetic moments of Fe(18e) atoms in [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n are strictly aligned along the c-axis.
QAs.answer: False

QAs.question: What is the relationship between the magnetic and structural phase transitions in [NH2(CH3)2]n[FeIIIFeII(HCOO)6]n?
QAs.answer: The magnetic phase transition is closely related to the structural phase transition, as the ordering of the dimethylammonium countercations during the structural phase transition influences the magnetic ordering and the ferrimagnetic behavior of the compound.
